paper_abstract: In this paper we introduce the notion of epsilon-universal prefix-free Turing machine (epsilon is a computable real in (0, 1]) and study its halting probability. The main result is the extension of the representability theorem for left-computable random teals to the case of epsilon-random teals: a real is left-computable epsilon-random if iris the halting probability of an epsilon-universal prefix-free Turing machine. We also show that left-computable epsilon-random teals are provable epsilon-random in the Peano Arithmetic. The theory developed here parallels to a large extent the classical theory, but not completely. For example, random teals are Borel normal (in any base), but for epsilon is an element of (0, 1); some epsilon-random teals do not contain even arbitrarily long runs of Os. (C) 2010 Elsevier Inc.
